Deutsche Bank Crypto Management

Deutsche Bank serves many clients involved with cryptocurrencies, but tracking their wallets is challenging due to crypto’s untraceable nature. To solve this, we built a secure, user-friendly app where employees can add customers and their wallets into a centralized database—creating an auditable trail of each client’s crypto holdings based on employee input.

User Roles

  • Regular Users: View, add, and edit customer profiles and wallets.
  • Admins: All Regular User permissions plus the ability to delete customers and wallets.

Technologies Used

  • Backend: Flask, SQLite, SQLAlchemy
  • Frontend: React
  • Dependencies: flask, flask_sqlalchemy, flask_cors
  • Environment: Python 3.13, VS Code
  • Testing: pytest, npm test

Why This Stack?

We chose Flask, SQLAlchemy, and React for fast development, seamless integration, and agile deployment. Flask’s minimal footprint and SQLAlchemy’s ORM simplify backend data workflows, while React delivers a modern, responsive UI. This modular approach offers more flexibility than all-in-one frameworks like Django and scales easily with evolving project needs.
